title: Elections source of legitimacy in UK and Nigeria

content.question: Which of the following correctly describes sources of legitimacy in two AP course countries?

choices.label: The United Kingdom and Nigeria both rely heavily on elections as a source of legitimacy.
Russia and the United Kingdom both depend largely on the charismatic authority of leaders as a source of legitimacy.
Although China relies entirely on economic growth as a primary source of legitimacy, Mexico relies on charismatic authority of its leader.
Although Iran relies primarily on elections to foster legitimacy, Russia relies on charismatic authority of its leader as a primary source of legitimacy.

content.answer: The United Kingdom and Nigeria both rely heavily on elections as a source of legitimacy.

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Compare two or more course countries based on their political systems, principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
